fi.luupanu.skrapple.domain

Class Rack

  • java.lang.Object
    • fi.luupanu.skrapple.domain.Rack

  • public class Rack
extends Object
    Every player has a unique rack that stores up to 7 letters. Using the letters players can form words on the board.
    Author:
    panu

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Rack()
      Create a new rack.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addLetter(Letter let)
      Adds a single letter back to the rack.
      boolean addLetters(List<Letter> letters)
      Adds a list of letters back to the rack.
      SortedMap<Integer,Letter> getContents() 
      List<Letter> getContentsAsList()
      Get contents of the rack as a list.
      int getRackMaxSize() 
      int getRackPoints()
      This method counts the score total of all letters in the rack.
      List<Letter> refillRack(LetterBag bag)
      Refills the rack so that the player always has the maximum (7) letters in her rack, if possible.
      Letter takeLetter(Letter let)
      Takes a letter from the rack.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Rack

        public Rack()
        Create a new rack. Maximum size of the rack is 7.

    • Method Detail

      • getContents

        public SortedMap<Integer,Letter> getContents()

      • getContentsAsList

        public List<Letter> getContentsAsList()
        Get contents of the rack as a list.
        Returns:
        a list of letters in the rack

      • getRackMaxSize

        public int getRackMaxSize()

      • getRackPoints

        public int getRackPoints()
        This method counts the score total of all letters in the rack. It's used in the end of the game to subtract remaining letters from the total player score.
        Returns:
        the value of the current letters in the rack

      • refillRack

        public List<Letter> refillRack(LetterBag bag)
        Refills the rack so that the player always has the maximum (7) letters in her rack, if possible.
        Parameters:
        bag - the letter bag
        Returns:
        a list of the new letters from the LetterBag

      • takeLetter

        public Letter takeLetter(Letter let)
        Takes a letter from the rack.
        Parameters:
        let - the letter to be taken
        Returns:
        the letter taken, null if not found

      • addLetters

        public boolean addLetters(List<Letter> letters)
        Adds a list of letters back to the rack. This method is used when canceling a LetterQueue.
        Parameters:
        letters - a list of letters to be added
        Returns:
        true only if all letters can be added

      • addLetter

        public boolean addLetter(Letter let)
        Adds a single letter back to the rack.
        Parameters:
        let - a single letter to be added
        Returns:
        true if the letter could be added to the rack
